Drones have been steadily creeping into the lives of people everywhere. During the Super Bowl, they made a stunning performance that showcased their potential. Similarly, Amazon has been gearing up a fleet of delivery drones. 
Now, Dubai's Road and Transportation Authority announced it will be using an aerial taxi service starting this summer, according to the Associated Press . 
The lucrative city will employ the "EHang 184," a one person quadcopter capable of carrying 220 pounds and flying for half an hour. 
With driverless passenger drones. Media: MediaOS Video 
The Chinese-made taxi drone has a top speed of 100 miles per hour, but Dubai officials said it will typically cruise through the city at 62 miles per hour. 
The drone service will kick off in July, pushing Dubai's futuristic goal of having driver-less vehicles perform 25 percent of the city's taxiing closer to completion.
